elements.content:
Here is a series of statements that represent how people can react to uncertainty in life.
Indicate to what extent each of the following statements corresponds to you.

elements.text: Uncertainty prevents me from taking a stand.
Being uncertain means that one is disorganized.
Uncertainty makes life intolerable.
It's unfair not to have guarantees in life.
I can't be at peace until I know what's going to happen tomorrow.
Uncertainty makes me uneasy, anxious, or stressed.
Unexpected events bother me enormously.
It frustrates me not to have all the information I need.
Uncertainty prevents me from enjoying life fully.
We should foresee everything to avoid surprises.
The smallest unexpected event can spoil everything, even with the best planning.
When it's time to act, uncertainty paralyzes me.
Being uncertain means that I'm not up to it.
When I am uncertain, I can't move forward.
When I am uncertain, I can't function very well.
Unlike me, others always seem to know where they're going in life.
Uncertainty makes me vulnerable, unhappy, or sad.
I always want to know what the future has in store for me.
I hate being taken by surprise.
The smallest doubt can stop me from acting.
I must be able to organize everything in advance.
Being uncertain means that I lack confidence.
I find it unfair that other people seem certain about their future.
Uncertainty prevents me from sleeping well.
I must get away from all uncertain situations.
The ambiguities in life stress me.
I can't stand being undecided about my future.
